snippet: Researchers say the four-winged, pigeon-size Microraptor had an iridescent sheen of black and blue and a pair of long tail feathers, perhaps to call attention to itself in courtship.
abstract: Study by American and Chinese scientists published online in journal Science finds that Microraptor, a four-winged dinosaur, developed its distinctive colored feather pattern for mating purposes, rather than flight; study capitalizes on new technology that allows researchers to determine the coloration of feather fossils.
lead_paragraph: Researchers say the four-winged, pigeon-size Microraptor had an iridescent sheen of black and blue and a pair of long tail feathers, perhaps to call attention to itself in courtship.

headline.seo: Feather Cells Tell of Microraptor’s Crowlike Sheen
headline.main: Feathers Worth a 2nd Look Found on a Tiny Dinosaur
headline.print_headline: Feathers Worth a 2nd Look Found on a Tiny Dinosaur
